Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Identified distinct patient cases based on age, gender, and logical activity flow. Grouped events using consistent attributes (age, gender) and plausible sequences like registration to triage to consultation to discharge.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Concluded that events with matching patient attributes within departments logically belong to single cases. Ensured activity sequences like triage to lab tests to consultations were followed.

Name: Validation - IND
Text: Cross-verified timestamps and sequential coherence for each case (e.g., lab tests requested before being completed, surgeries following preparation). Addressed inconsistencies in timestamp data by assuming logical corrections to maintain continuity.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Applied expected hospital workflows (e.g., X-ray before consultation, surgery preparation before surgery) to resolve interleaved events and infer case groupings.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Inferred that events with identical patient demographics (e.g., 28M) and within the same department (Surgery) across timestamps are related to the same case.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Hypothesized that interleaved events represent distinct cases with a maximum number of three based on three unique patient profiles. Tested this hypothesis by mapping activities to coherent patient journeys.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - NE
Text: Encountered timestamp conflict in lab test events (event 10), which violated chronological order. Assumed a likely typo but proceeded despite limited clarity, which introduced a potential minor logical flaw in reasoning.
